TAXONOMIC CLASS.content: TAXONOMIC CLASS: Coarse-loamy, isotic Typic Dystrocryepts

TYPICAL PEDON.content:
TYPICAL PEDON: Blackpoint silt loam on a south facing convex, linear backslope, on a slope of 55 percent at an elevation of 237 m (The soil was dry to 30 cm and moist throughout the rest of the profile when described on July 18, 2019.)
Oe--0 to 2 cm; moderately decomposed plant material, very dark brown (10YR 2/2) dry, black (10YR 2/1) moist; many very fine, fine, and medium roots; very strongly acid (pH 4.9); abrupt irregular boundary
A--2 to 8 cm; silt loam, very dark grayish brown (10YR 3/2) dry, very dark brown (10YR 2/2) moist; weak very fine granular structure; very friable, nonsticky, nonplastic; many very fine and fine roots; few very fine, fine, and medium irregular pores; very strongly acid (pH 5.0); abrupt irregular boundary
Bw1--8 to 17 cm; silt loam, dark yellowish brown (10YR 4/4) dry, dark brown (10YR 3/3) moist; weak fine subangular blocky structure; very friable, nonsticky, nonplastic; many very fine and common fine roots; few very fin, fine, and medium irregular pores; 10 percent angular gravel; strongly acid (pH 5.3); clear irregular boundary
Bw2--17 to 32 cm; gravelly silt loam, brown (7.5YR 4/4) dry, very dark brown (7.5YR 2.5/2) moist; weak coarse granular structure; very friable, slightly sticky, moderately plastic; many very fine and few fine roots; common very fine irregular pores; 25 percent angular gravel; strongly acid (pH 5.3); clear smooth boundary
Bw3--32 to 85 cm; gravelly silt loam, 50 percent light yellowish brown (10YR 6/4) and 50 percent pale brown (10YR 6/3) dry, 50 percent dark yellowish brown (10YR 4/4) and 50 percent brown (10YR 4/3) moist; moderate thin platy structure; friable, slightly sticky, nonplastic; few very fine and fine roots; many very fine irregular pores; 3 percent medium dark yellowish brown (10YR 4/6), moist, masses of oxidized iron; 25 percent angular gravel; strongly acid (pH 5.4); gradual smooth boundary
Cr--85 cm; dark gray (5Y 4/1) dry, black (5Y 2/1) moist

TYPE LOCATION.content: TYPE LOCATION: Nome Census Area County, Alaska, latitude 63.2982415 longitude -160.8401253 degrees, datum WGS84 (Coordinates determined with a GPS unit)

COMPETING SERIES.content:
COMPETING SERIES:
*Tolukowuk--moderately deep to densic layer

GEOGRAPHIC SETTING.content:
GEOGRAPHIC SETTING:
*Elevation--50 to 550 m
*Climate--warm, moist summers; cold, dry winters
*Mean annual precipitation--400 to 550 mm
*Mean annual air temperature-- -5 to -1 degrees C
*Frost-free period--45 to 80 days

GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS.content:
GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS:
*Paugna--very deep, umbric epipedon; shoulders and upper backslopes of mountains
*Golsovia--very deep; side slopes and nose slopes of hills and escarpments
*MountMcDonald--shallow to lithic contact; shoulders and summits of mountains

DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY.content:
DRAINAGE AND SATURATED HYDRAULIC CONDUCTIVITY:
*Drainage class--well drained
*Saturation during normal years--none
*Saturated hydraulic conductivity (Ksat)--high to moderately high throughout the profile

USE AND VEGETATION.content:
USE AND VEGETATION:
Use--wildlife habitat, recreation, subsistence
Potential native vegetation--quaking aspen, white spruce, bluejoint, bunchberry dogwood, Barclay's willow, marsh Labrador tea, alpine azalea, bog blueberry, tealeaf willow, lingonberry, western oakfern, fireweed, cup lichen, greygreen reindeer lichen, moss, juniper polytrichum moss, black crowberry, stiff clubmoss, running clubmoss, star reindeer lichen, felt lichen, Schreber's big red stem moss, splendid feather moss, polytrichum moss

DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT.content: DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT: Nulato Hills-Southern Seward Peninsula Highlands, Alaska; MLRA 240; moderate extent

REGIONAL OFFICE.content: SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (SSRO) RESPONSIBLE: Portland, Oregon

ORIGIN.content: SERIES PROPOSED: Nulato Hills BLM area, Nome Census Area, Alaska; 2020

REMARKS.content:
REMARKS:
Diagnostic horizons and features recognized in this pedon
*Particle-size control section--zone from 27 to 85 cm
*Ochric epipedon--zone from 0 to 8 cm
*Cambic horizon--zone from 8 to 85 cm
*Paralithic contact--85 cm
